content: st slip_stitch to first single_crochet 32 r2 chain 1 increase in first st single_crochet in the next 13 sts increase single_crochet increase single_crochet in the next 13 sts increase single_crochet increase slip_stitch to first single_crochet 36 r3 chain 1 in blo single_crochet around slip_stitch to first single_crochet 36 r4-r13 chain 1 single_crochet around slip_stitch to first single_crochet 36 option 1 fasten_off leave a long tail for sewing option 2 chain 1 r14 single_crochet across 17 sts chain 1 & turn 17 r15-r20 single_crochet around chain 1 & turn 17 r21 single_crochet in first 7 sts chain 3 & skip 3 sts single_crochet in last 7 sts 17 fasten ff & reattach your yarn to the side of the first stitch of row 14 single_crochet up the side of the flap working 1 single_crochet into the side of each row place 2 single_crochet into the corner then single_crochet across the top of the flap work 3 single_crochet into your chain 3 space place another 2 single_crochet into the next corner and single_crochet down the other side of the flap fasten_off leave a long tail for sewing close flap and mark where you want your button sew into place option 3 fasten_off & weave in ends create a top cover by following rounds 1 & 2 again fasten_off leave a long tail for sewing stuff your backpack and line up your cover piece with your backpack whip stitch the cover onto your backpack use the remaining tail to sew your completed backpack onto your crewmate s body assembly attach your crewmate s backpack to the back of his body between rounds 17 and 29 the visor will attach to the front of your crewmate s body between rounds 25 and 34 lightly stuff as you sew it on with a small amount of white yarn embroider a highlight onto the visor by sewing a long stitch between rounds 2 and 3 see photos for placement suggestion fasten_off & weave in all ends copyright notice all pattern text and photos are © amanda perkins glamazon crochet designs and may not be copied for any purpose including but not limited to redistribution online or in print if you wish to share this or any other pattern please provide the recipient with a link to the pattern instead if you wish to use one or more of my patterns in a round-up on your own blog you may use one 1 photo per pattern the among us game and its characters crewmate imposter pets are not my intellectual property thus i cannot give permission to sell finished products created from this pattern if you post a photo of your finished product on social media a link to www facebook com/glamazoncrochet or the pattern page is ​ greatly appreciated your adherence to these guidelines is appreciated and ensures that i can continue providing quality patterns free of charge
